EN

XRP has experienced significant volatility despite a recent 19% price surge, with on-chain data revealing rising exchange reserves that suggest potential selling pressure. Analysts have warned investors about the possibility of "bull traps" and advised against rushing into dip-buying strategies until a sustained uptrend is confirmed. The market sentiment remains fearful, creating uncertainty about whether the asset will stabilize or face further downside. Amid this bearish sentiment, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse sparked speculation by sharing a Warren Buffett quote about being "greedy when others are fearful." Many traders interpreted this as a subtle signal to maintain long-term confidence during the market downturn. While short-term metrics remain cautious, supporters continue to highlight Ripple's institutional partnerships and the expansion of the XRP Ledger as fundamental drivers for future growth.

Key Points

  • On-chain data shows rising XRP exchange reserves, signaling potential sell pressure despite a 19% price gain.
  • Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse shared a Warren Buffett quote about being 'greedy when others are fearful,' interpreted as a long-term buy signal.
  • Analysts advise caution against immediate dip-buying due to 'bull trap' risks, while supporters point to institutional partnerships for long-term value.

Article

The recent pullback in the crypto market has pushed XRP into a period of volatility, but comments linked to Brad Garlinghouse, CEO of Ripple, are stirring fresh discussion among investors about whether the downturn could present a buying opportunity. Market Fear Rises as XRP Metrics Turn Bearish XRP has been moving in line with the broader crypto market decline, with several indicators showing weakening momentum. On-chain data indicates that XRP exchange reserves recently climbed to around 2.7 billion tokens, meaning that some investors are moving holdings onto exchanges — often interpreted as a signal that traders may be preparing to sell. However, at the time of writing, XRP has gained more than 19% in the last 24 hours. Analysts warn that short-term rebounds could also turn into “bull traps,” where prices briefly rise before continuing lower, making timing the market difficult. Investors Urged to Wait for Confirmation Several experts have advised investors to avoid rushing into dip-buying strategies. Historically, sharp corrections can continue longer than expected, and analysts say confirmation of a sustained uptrend is often safer than trying to catch a “falling knife.” This approach shows the broader uncertainty in the crypto market, where sentiment indicators have recently slipped into extreme fear territory. Garlinghouse Quote Interpreted as Subtle Signal Amid the downturn, Garlinghouse shared the well-known Warren Buffett quote: “Be fearful when others are greedy and greedy when others are fearful.” My favorite Warren Buffet quote: "Be fearful when others are greedy, and greedy when others are fearful!" — Brad Garlinghouse (@bgarlinghouse) February 5, 2026 While the Ripple CEO did not directly comment on XRP’s price, many traders interpreted the post as a possible signal encouraging long-term confidence during the market’s fear phase. Social media reactions from XRP supporters quickly framed the message as a reminder that major opportunities often appear during market stress. Long-Term Fundamentals Still in Focus Despite short-term bearish signals, XRP supporters continue pointing to Ripple’s ongoing institutional partnerships, payment-network expansion, and new use cases on the XRP Ledger as long-term drivers that could support the asset once broader market sentiment improves. For now, analysts say the coming months could determine whether the market stabilizes into a consolidation phase or experiences additional downside.
